     <div class="header-main" data-reactid="265">
      <div class="wrapper fluid" data-reactid="266">
       <a href="/" class="logo logo-header icon-only" data-reactid="267">Cloudflare</a>

         <li data-reactid="271"><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com" data-reactid="272">Blog</a></li>

    <div class="site-wrapper body-container" data-reactid="277">
     <div class="page-header" data-reactid="278">
      <div class="wrapper" data-reactid="279">
       <h1 class="text-light text-center" data-reactid="280">Cloudflare API documentation v4</h1>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="main-content wrapper" data-reactid="281">
      <div data-reactid="282">
       <article class="section api-section" data-reactid="283">
        <p data-reactid="284"><small data-reactid="285">
          <!-- react-text: 286 -->Last modified: 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 287 -->September 21st, 2017
          <!-- /react-text --></small></p>
        <h2 data-reactid="288">Getting started</h2>
        <p data-reactid="289">Cloudflare's API exposes the entire Cloudflare infrastructure via a standardized programmatic interface. Using Cloudflare's API, you can do just about anything you can do on cloudflare.com via the customer dashboard.</p>
        <p data-reactid="290">
         <!-- react-text: 291 -->The Cloudflare API is a RESTful API based on HTTPS requests and JSON responses. If you are registered with Cloudflare, you can obtain your API key from the bottom of the "My Account" page, found here: 
         <!-- /react-text -->
         <!-- react-text: 292 --> 
         <!-- /react-text --><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/a/account" data-reactid="293">Go to My account.</a></p>
       </article>
       <article class="section guidelines-section" data-reactid="294">
        <h2 data-reactid="295">What is Cloudflare?</h2>
        <p data-reactid="296">Cloudflare makes sites lightning fast, protects them from attacks, ensures they are always online, and makes it simple to add web apps with a single click. More than 5 percent of global Web requests flow through Cloudflare's network; every month more than 1.8 billion people experience a faster, safer, better Internet thanks to Cloudflare.</p>
        <h2 data-reactid="297">Audience for APIs</h2>
        <p data-reactid="298">Cloudflare offers public APIs with three audiences in mind.</p>
        <ol data-reactid="299">
         <li data-reactid="300">Cloudflare customers</li>
         <li data-reactid="301">Cloudflare partners</li>
         <li data-reactid="302">Developers</li>
        </ol>
        <p data-reactid="303"><em data-reactid="304">Customers</em>
         <!-- react-text: 305 -->: Individuals and organizations all over the world choose Cloudflare to protect and accelerate their web applications. Most customers manage their settings in the web dashboard, built using these APIs. Virtually anything you can do in the customer dashboard may be done via API. Example: purging the Cloudflare edge cache for a 
         <!-- /react-text --><a href="#zone-purge-individual-files" data-reactid="306">single file</a>
         <!-- react-text: 307 --> when it's updated on the origin server.
         <!-- /react-text --></p>
        <p data-reactid="308"><em data-reactid="309">Partners</em>
         <!-- react-text: 310 -->: Many organizations make using Cloudflare a seamless option for improving their customers' performance and security. These APIs make that easier to do at scale. Example: a Cloudflare Certified Hosting Partner may use APIs to 
         <!-- /react-text --><a href="#zone-settings-for-a-zone-change-security-level-setting" data-reactid="311">toggle basic security mode</a>
         <!-- react-text: 312 --> inside a hosting control panel.
         <!-- /react-text --></p>
        <p data-reactid="313"><em data-reactid="314">Developers</em>
         <!-- react-text: 315 -->: Developers all over the world create useful applications which tie into Cloudflare services. These applications may include plugins and extensions to 
         <!-- /react-text --><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/cloudflare/" data-reactid="316">popular content management systems</a>
         <!-- react-text: 317 -->, apps that are offered in the Cloudflare Apps marketplace, runbooks for specific deployment systems, and many others.
         <!-- /react-text --></p>
        <h2 data-reactid="318">Do's and Don'ts</h2>
        <h4 data-reactid="319">What can you build with Cloudflare APIs?</h4>
        <p data-reactid="320">Anything that's useful and follows the guidelines presented here.</p>
        <h4 data-reactid="321">What should you avoid doing with Cloudflare APIs?</h4>
        <p data-reactid="322">Do not do any of the following:</p>
        <ul data-reactid="323">
         <li data-reactid="324">Abuse Cloudflare systems or customers</li>
         <li data-reactid="325">Misuse Cloudflare trademarks</li>
         <li data-reactid="326">Misrepresent Cloudflare services as your own</li>
        </ul>
        <p data-reactid="327"><em data-reactid="328">Abuse</em>
         <!-- react-text: 329 -->: Follow all guidelines, including the rate limits defined 
         <!-- /react-text --><a href="#requests" data-reactid="330">below</a>
         <!-- react-text: 331 -->. Your ability to use the Cloudflare APIs may be terminated, temporarily or permanently, if our systems are abused. Similarly, anything in an application which goes against the goal of making Cloudflare more useful to Cloudflare customers or attempts to mistreat customers or their data will be grounds for termination.
         <!-- /react-text --></p>
        <p data-reactid="332"><em data-reactid="333">Trademarks</em>
         <!-- react-text: 334 -->: Cloudflare has several registered trademarks. Details on how and when you may use Cloudflare trademarks are found at https://www.cloudflare.com/trademark, with links to specifics on 
         <!-- /react-text -->
         <!-- react-text: 335 --> 
         <!-- /react-text --><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/logo" data-reactid="336">logo use</a>
         <!-- react-text: 337 --> and 
         <!-- /react-text --><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/spelling" data-reactid="338">spelling</a>
         <!-- react-text: 339 -->. Please review carefully.
         <!-- /react-text --></p>
        <p data-reactid="340"><em data-reactid="341">Misrepresentation</em>
         <!-- react-text: 342 -->: Draw a clear line between the benefits you provide in your application and those benefits of the Cloudflare service that you enable via API. The APIs are not intended for "white labeling" or reselling Cloudflare services as your own. Nothing in your service or application should create a false sense of endorsement, sponsorship, or association with Cloudflare. You may sell your own application or service which utilizes the Cloudflare APIs, but may not sell Cloudflare services to customers without a commercial agreement with Cloudflare.
         <!-- /react-text --></p>
        <p data-reactid="343">
         <!-- react-text: 344 -->The full Cloudflare Terms of Use are found at 
         <!-- /react-text --><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/terms" data-reactid="345">https://www.cloudflare.com/terms</a>
         <!-- react-text: 346 -->.
         <!-- /react-text --></p>
       </article>
       <article class="section api-section" data-reactid="347">
        <a class="anchor2" id="getting-started-endpoints" data-reactid="348">getting-started-endpoints</a>
        <h2 data-reactid="349">Endpoints</h2>
        <p data-reactid="350">The API is accessed by making HTTPS requests to a specific version endpoint URL, in which GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE methods dictate how your interact with the information available. Every endpoint is accessed only via the SSL-enabled HTTPS (port 443) protocol.</p>
        <p data-reactid="351">Everything (methods, parameters, etc.) is fixed to a version number, and every call must contain one. The latest version is Version 4.</p>
        <p data-reactid="352">The stable base URL for all Version 4 HTTPS endpoints is:</p>
        <p class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="353">https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/</p>
       </article>
       <article class="section api-section" data-reactid="354">
        <a class="anchor2" id="getting-started-requests" data-reactid="355">getting-started-requests</a>
        <h2 data-reactid="356">Requests</h2>
        <p data-reactid="357">
         <!-- react-text: 358 -->Requests must be sent over HTTPS with any payload formatted in JSON. All requests must include both 
         <!-- /react-text --><span class="label code" data-reactid="359">X-Auth-Key</span>
         <!-- react-text: 360 --> and 
         <!-- /react-text --><span class="label code" data-reactid="361">X-Auth-Email</span>
         <!-- react-text: 362 --> headers to authenticate. Requests that use 
         <!-- /react-text --><span class="label code" data-reactid="363">X-Auth-User-Service-Key</span>
         <!-- react-text: 364 --> can use that instead of the Auth-Key and Auth-Email headers. 
         <!-- /react-text --></p>
        <section class="modunit" data-reactid="365">
         <h4 class="mod-content" data-reactid="366"><em data-reactid="367">Required</em>
          <!-- react-text: 368 --> parameters
          <!-- /react-text --></h4>
         <table class="table table-striped input-parameters" data-reactid="369">
          <thead data-reactid="370">
           <tr data-reactid="371">
            <th data-reactid="372">Name</th>
            <th data-reactid="373">Format</th>
            <th data-reactid="374">Description</th>
           </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody data-reactid="375">
           <tr data-reactid="376">
            <td data-reactid="377"><strong data-reactid="378">API Key</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="379"><em data-reactid="380">X-Auth-Key</em></td>
            <td data-reactid="381">API key generated on the "My Account" page</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="382">
            <td data-reactid="383"><strong data-reactid="384">Email</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="385"><em data-reactid="386">X-Auth-Email</em></td>
            <td data-reactid="387">Email address associated with your account</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="388">
            <td data-reactid="389"><strong data-reactid="390">User Service Key</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="391"><em data-reactid="392">X-Auth-User-Service-Key</em></td>
            <td data-reactid="393">A special Cloudflare API key good for a restricted set of endpoints. Always begins with "v1.0-", may vary in length.</td>
           </tr>
          </tbody>
         </table>
         <div class="mod-header" data-reactid="394">
          <h4 data-reactid="395">Example request</h4>
          <p data-reactid="396">Requests are generally formatted as follows:</p>
          <pre class="language-http" style="margin:0.5em 0 0;" data-reactid="397">GET object/:object_id</pre>
         </div>
         <div class="mod-content" data-reactid="398">
          <h5 data-reactid="399">
           <!-- react-text: 400 -->Auth-Email cURL 
           <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="401">(example)</small></h5>
         </div>
         <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="402">
          <pre data-reactid="403">curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/cd7d0123e3012345da9420df9514dad0" \
     -H "Content-Type:application/json" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key:1234567893feefc5f0q5000bfo0c38d90bbeb" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email:<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="b5d0cdd4d8c5d9d0f5d0cdd4d8c5d9d09bd6dad8">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>"</pre>
         </div>
         <div class="mod-content" data-reactid="404">
          <h5 data-reactid="405">
           <!-- react-text: 406 -->User-Service cURL 
           <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="407">(example)</small></h5>
         </div>
         <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="408">
          <pre data-reactid="409">
           <!-- react-text: 410 -->curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/cd7d0123e3012345da9420df9514dad0" \
     -H "Content-Type:application/json" \
     -H "X-Auth-User-Service-Key:v1.0-e24fd090c02efcfecb4de8f4ff246fd5c75b48946fdf0ce26c59f91d0d90797b-cfa33fe60e8e34073c149323454383fc9005d25c9b4c502c2f063457ef65322eade065975001a0b4b4c591c5e1bd36a6e8f7e2d4fa8a9ec01c64c041e99530c2-07b9efe0acd78c82c8d9c690aacb8656d81c369246d7f996a205fe3c18e9254a"
           <!-- /react-text -->
           <!-- react-text: 411 -->`
           <!-- /react-text --></pre>
         </div>
        </section>
        <section class="modunit" data-reactid="412">
         <header class="mod-header" data-reactid="413">
          <h4 data-reactid="414">Rate limiting</h4>
          <p data-reactid="415">The Cloudflare API sets a maximum of 1,200 requests in a five minute period.</p>
          <p data-reactid="416">Cache-Tag purging has a lower rate limit of up to 2,000 purge API calls in every 24 hour period. You may purge up to 30 tags in one API call.</p>
         </header>
        </section>
        <section class="modunit" data-reactid="417">
         <div class="mod-header" data-reactid="418">
          <h4 data-reactid="419">Pagination</h4>
          <p data-reactid="420">Depending on your request, the results returned may be limited. You can page through the returned results with the following query parameters.</p>
         </div>
         <table class="table table-striped input-parameters" data-reactid="421">
          <thead data-reactid="422">
           <tr data-reactid="423">
            <th data-reactid="424">Name</th>
            <th data-reactid="425">Type</th>
            <th data-reactid="426">Description</th>
           </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody data-reactid="427">
           <tr data-reactid="428">
            <td data-reactid="429"><strong data-reactid="430">page</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="431"><em data-reactid="432">integer</em></td>
            <td data-reactid="433">Which page of results to return</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="434">
            <td data-reactid="435"><strong data-reactid="436">per_page</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="437"><em data-reactid="438">integer</em></td>
            <td data-reactid="439">How many results to return per page</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="440">
            <td data-reactid="441"><strong data-reactid="442">order</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="443"><em data-reactid="444">string</em></td>
            <td data-reactid="445">Attribute name to order the responses by</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="446">
            <td data-reactid="447"><strong data-reactid="448">direction</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="449"><em data-reactid="450">string</em></td>
            <td data-reactid="451">
             <!-- react-text: 452 -->Either 
             <!-- /react-text --><span class="label code" data-reactid="453">asc</span>
             <!-- react-text: 454 --> or 
             <!-- /react-text --><span class="label code" data-reactid="455">desc</span></td>
           </tr>
          </tbody>
         </table>
         <div class="mod-content" data-reactid="456">
          <h5 data-reactid="457">
           <!-- react-text: 458 -->cURL 
           <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="459">(example)</small></h5>
          <pre class="language-http" style="margin:0.5em 0 0;" data-reactid="460">GET zones/:zone_identifier/dns_records</pre>
         </div>
         <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="461">
          <pre data-reactid="462">curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/cd7d068de3012345da9420df9514dad0/dns_records?page=3&amp;per_page=20&amp;order=type&amp;direction=asc" \
     -H "Content-Type:application/json" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key:1234567893feefc5f0q5000bfo0c38d90bbeb" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email:<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="dcb9a4bdb1acb0b99cb9a4bdb1acb0b9f2bfb3b1">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>"</pre>
         </div>
        </section>
       </article>
       <article class="section api-section" data-reactid="463">
        <a class="anchor2" id="getting-started-responses" data-reactid="464">getting-started-responses</a>
        <h2 data-reactid="465">Responses</h2>
        <div data-reactid="466">
         <h4 data-reactid="467">Format</h4>
         <p data-reactid="468">
          <!-- react-text: 469 -->Each response is a JSON object. The data requested is wrapped in the 
          <!-- /react-text --><span class="label code" data-reactid="470">result</span>
          <!-- react-text: 471 --> tag. If you have a response, it will always be within the 
          <!-- /react-text --><span class="label code" data-reactid="472">result</span>
          <!-- react-text: 473 --> field. We also include a 
          <!-- /react-text --><span class="label code" data-reactid="474">success</span>
          <!-- react-text: 475 --> flag, an array of potential 
          <!-- /react-text --><span class="label code" data-reactid="476">errors</span>
          <!-- react-text: 477 -->, and 
          <!-- /react-text --><span class="label code" data-reactid="478">messages</span>
          <!-- react-text: 479 --> in the response. Some responses can have additional pagination info wrapped in the 
          <!-- /react-text --><span class="label code" data-reactid="480">result_info</span></p>
         <p data-reactid="481">
          <!-- react-text: 482 -->An error object will contain an integer 
          <!-- /react-text --><span class="label code" data-reactid="483">code</span>
          <!-- react-text: 484 --> field and a 
          <!-- /react-text --><span class="label code" data-reactid="485">message</span></p>
         <p data-reactid="486">Date fields will always be in UTC ISO-8601 format, including microseconds.</p>
        </div>
        <section class="modunit" data-reactid="487">
         <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="488">
          <!-- react-text: 489 -->Success Response 
          <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="490">(example)</small></h5>
         <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="491">
          <pre data-reactid="492">{
  "result": {
    "id":"2d4d028de3015345da9420df5514dad0",
    "type":"A",
    "name":"blog.example.com",
    "content":"2.6.4.5",
    "proxiable":true,
    "proxied":false,
    "ttl":1,
    "priority":0,
    "locked":false,
    "zone_id":"cd7d068de3012345da9420df9514dad0",
    "zone_name":"example.com",
    "modified_on":"2014-05-28T18:46:18.764425Z",
    "created_on":"2014-05-28T18:46:18.764425Z"
  },
  "success": true,
  "errors": [],
  "messages": [],
  "result_info": {
    "page": 1,
    "per_page": 20,
    "count": 1,
    "total_count": 200
  }
}</pre>
         </div>
        </section>
        <section class="modunit" data-reactid="493">
         <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="494">
          <!-- react-text: 495 -->Error Response 
          <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="496">(example)</small></h5>
         <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="497">
          <pre data-reactid="498">{
  "result": null,
  "success": false,
  "errors": [{"code":1003,"message":"Invalid or missing zone id."}],
  "messages": []
}</pre>
         </div>
        </section>
       </article>
       <article class="section api-section" id="content-types" data-reactid="499">
        <section class="modunit" data-reactid="500">
         <div class="mod-header" data-reactid="501">
          <h4 data-reactid="502">HTTP Content-Type</h4>
          <p data-reactid="503">The response format can be determined from the HTTP Content-Type header. Most API responses are JSON (Content-Type: application/json).</p>
         </div>
         <table class="table table-striped input-parameters" data-reactid="504">
          <thead data-reactid="505">
           <tr data-reactid="506">
            <th data-reactid="507">Content-Type</th>
            <th data-reactid="508">Description</th>
           </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody data-reactid="509">
           <tr data-reactid="510">
            <td data-reactid="511">application/json</td>
            <td data-reactid="512">response is a JSON object</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="513">
            <td data-reactid="514">text/plain</td>
            <td data-reactid="515">response is a textual item</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="516">
            <td data-reactid="517">application/x-yaml</td>
            <td data-reactid="518">response is a YAML object</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="519">
            <td data-reactid="520">application/octet-stream</td>
            <td data-reactid="521">response is a raw data (reserved for later use)</td>
           </tr>
          </tbody>
         </table>
        </section>
       </article>
       <article class="section api-section" id="response-codes" data-reactid="522">
        <section class="modunit" data-reactid="523">
         <div class="mod-header" data-reactid="524">
          <h4 data-reactid="525">HTTP response codes</h4>
          <p data-reactid="526">The status of a response can be determined from the HTTP status code.</p>
         </div>
         <table class="table table-striped input-parameters" data-reactid="527">
          <thead data-reactid="528">
           <tr data-reactid="529">
            <th data-reactid="530">Code</th>
            <th data-reactid="531">Status</th>
            <th data-reactid="532">Description</th>
           </tr>
          </thead>
          <tbody data-reactid="533">
           <tr data-reactid="534">
            <td data-reactid="535"><strong data-reactid="536">200</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="537">OK</td>
            <td data-reactid="538">request successful</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="539">
            <td data-reactid="540"><strong data-reactid="541">304</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="542">Not Modified</td>
            <td data-reactid="543"></td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="544">
            <td data-reactid="545"><strong data-reactid="546">400</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="547">Bad Request</td>
            <td data-reactid="548">request was invalid</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="549">
            <td data-reactid="550"><strong data-reactid="551">401</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="552">Unauthorized</td>
            <td data-reactid="553">user does not have permission</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="554">
            <td data-reactid="555"><strong data-reactid="556">403</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="557">Forbidden</td>
            <td data-reactid="558">request not authenticated</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="559">
            <td data-reactid="560"><strong data-reactid="561">429</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="562">Too many requests</td>
            <td data-reactid="563">client is rate limited</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="564">
            <td data-reactid="565"><strong data-reactid="566">405</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="567">Method Not Allowed</td>
            <td data-reactid="568">incorrect HTTP method provided</td>
           </tr>
           <tr data-reactid="569">
            <td data-reactid="570"><strong data-reactid="571">415</strong></td>
            <td data-reactid="572">Unsupported Media Type</td>
            <td data-reactid="573">response is not valid JSON</td>
           </tr>
          </tbody>
         </table>
        </section>
       </article>
       <article class="section api-section" data-reactid="574">
        <a class="anchor2" id="getting-started-resource-ids" data-reactid="575">getting-started-resource-ids</a>
        <h2 data-reactid="576">How to get a Zone ID, User ID, or Organization ID</h2>
        <p data-reactid="577">
         <!-- react-text: 578 -->Nearly every resource in the v4 API (Users, Zones, Settings, Organizations, etc.) may be uniquely identified by a 32-byte string of hex characters (
         <!-- /react-text --><code data-reactid="579">[a-f0-9]</code>
         <!-- react-text: 580 -->). These identifiers may be referred to in the documentation as 
         <!-- /react-text --><code data-reactid="581">zone_identifier</code>
         <!-- react-text: 582 -->, 
         <!-- /react-text --><code data-reactid="583">user_id</code>
         <!-- react-text: 584 -->, or even just 
         <!-- /react-text --><code data-reactid="585">id</code>
         <!-- react-text: 586 -->. Identifier values are usually captured during resource creation (POST requests) or when fetching entire collections (GET requests) of resources. Typically they appear as an 
         <!-- /react-text --><code data-reactid="587">id</code>
         <!-- react-text: 588 --> field in the JSON resource.
         <!-- /react-text --></p>
        <pre data-reactid="589">{
  "result": {
    "id":"2d4d028de3015345da9420df5514dad0",
    "type":"example"
  }
}</pre>
        <p data-reactid="590">
         <!-- react-text: 591 -->You can always find the IDs for API resources by making a GET request to its corresponding collection endpoint. For example, to list all Zone objects, a GET request may be sent to https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones. All objects listed in the result array will contain an 
         <!-- /react-text --><code data-reactid="592">id</code>
         <!-- react-text: 593 --> field; this is also known as 
         <!-- /react-text --><code data-reactid="594">zone_identifier</code>
         <!-- react-text: 595 -->.
         <!-- /react-text --></p>
        <h3 data-reactid="596">How to Get a Zone ID</h3>
        <pre data-reactid="597">curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones" \
    -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="d6a3a5b3a496b3aeb7bba6bab3f8b5b9bb">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \
    -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
    -H "Content-Type: application/json"</pre>
       </article>
      </div>
      <article class="section api-section" data-reactid="598">
       <header data-reactid="599">
        <div style="position:absolute;margin:-5em;" id="user" data-reactid="600"></div>

        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="643">
         <pre data-reactid="644">curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/user" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="7b0e081e093b1e031a160b171e55181416">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json"</pre>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="645">
         <!-- react-text: 646 -->Response 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="647">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="648">
         <pre data-reactid="649">{
  "success": true,
  "errors": [
    {}
  ],
  "messages": [
    {}
  ],
  "result": {
    "id": "7c5dae5552338874e5053f2534d2767a",
    "email": "<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="136660766153766b727e637f763d707c7e">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>",
    "first_name": "John",
    "last_name": "Appleseed",
    "username": "cfuser12345",
    "telephone": "+1 123-123-1234",
    "country": "US",
    "zipcode": "12345",

       </section>
       <section class="modunit" data-reactid="650">
        <a class="anchor2" id="user-update-user" data-reactid="651">user-update-user</a>
        <div class="mod-header" data-reactid="652">
         <h3 class="mod-title" data-reactid="653"><span class="label label-info" data-reactid="654">PATCH</span>
          <!-- react-text: 655 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 656 -->Update user
          <!-- /react-text -->

          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 658 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <ul class="available-plans inline" data-reactid="659">
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="660"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="661">free</h6>

          </ul></h3>
         <div data-reactid="672">
          <p>Update part of your user details</p> 
         </div>
         <pre class="language-http" style="margin:0.5em 0 0;" data-reactid="673">
          <!-- react-text: 674 -->PATCH
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 675 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 676 -->user
          <!-- /react-text --></pre>
        </div>
        <div data-reactid="677">
         <h4 class="mod-content" data-reactid="678"><em data-reactid="679">Optional</em>
          <!-- react-text: 680 --> parameters
          <!-- /react-text --></h4>
         <div class="overflow-scroll object-definition-table" data-reactid="681">
          <table class="table table-striped" data-reactid="682">
           <thead data-reactid="683">

     -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="9aefe9ffe8daffe2fbf7eaf6ffb4f9f5f7">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"first_name":"John","last_name":"Appleseed","telephone":"+1 123-123-1234","country":"US","zipcode":"12345"}'</pre>
        </div>

         <!-- react-text: 1017 -->cURL 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="1018">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="1019">
         <pre data-reactid="1020">curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/user/billing/history?page=1&amp;per_page=20&amp;order=occured_at&amp;type=charge&amp;occured_at=2014-03-01T12:21:59.3456Z&amp;action=subscription" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="4d383e283f0d28352c203d2128632e2220">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json"</pre>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="1021">
         <!-- react-text: 1022 -->Response 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="1023">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="1024">
         <pre data-reactid="1025">{
  "success": true,
  "errors": [
    {}
  ],
  "messages": [
    {}
  ],
  "result": [
    {
      "id": "b69a9f3492637782896352daae219e7d",
      "type": "charge",
      "action": "subscription",
      "description": "The billing item description",
      "occurred_at": "2014-03-01T12:21:59.3456Z",
      "amount": 20.99,
      "currency": "USD",
      "zone": {
        "name": "example.com"
      }
    }
  ],
  "result_info": {
    "page": 1,
    "per_page": 20,
    "count": 1,
    "total_count": 2000
  }
}</pre>
        </div>
       </section>
      </article>

     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \

     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"id":"506e3185e9c882d175a2d0cb0093d9f2","state":"Paid","price":20,"currency":"USD","component_values":[{"name":"page_rules","value":20,"default":5,"price":5}],"zone":{"id":"023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353","name":"example.com"},"frequency":"monthly","rate_plan":{"id":"free","public_name":"Business Plan","currency":"USD","scope":"zone","externally_managed":false},"current_period_end":"2014-03-31T12:20:00Z","current_period_start":"2014-05-11T12:20:00Z"}'</pre>

      <article class="section api-section" data-reactid="1324">
       <header data-reactid="1325">
        <div style="position:absolute;margin:-5em;" id="user-level-firewall-access-rule" data-reactid="1326"></div>
        <h2 data-reactid="1327">User-level Firewall access rule</h2>
        <h4 class="subheadline" data-reactid="1328">A firewall access rule applied to all zones owned by the user</h4>
       </header>

                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 1449 -->The configuration_value can be in the following formats: IP, country code or ASN (Autonomous System Number). IP is a single IP address or a subnet. /16 and /24 subnets are accepted for IPv4 addresses and /32, /48 and /64 are accepted for IPv6 addresses. Country code is an ISO 2-letter country code. ASN should be prefixed with AS followed by the number. Eg. AS12345.
                <!-- /react-text --></li>

     -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="88fdfbedfac8edf0e9e5f8e4eda6ebe7e5">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \

          </ul></h3>
         <div data-reactid="1572">
          <p>Make a new IP, IP range, or country access rule for all zones owned by the user. Note: If you would like to create an access rule that applies to a specific zone only, use the zone firewall endpoints.</p>

         <!-- react-text: 1676 -->cURL

        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="1678">
         <pre data-reactid="1679">curl -X POST "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/user/firewall/access_rules/rules" \

              </div></td>

              <ul class="constraints unstyled" data-reactid="2003">
               <li data-reactid="2004">
                <!-- react-text: 2005 -->valid values: 
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2006 -->asc, desc
                <!-- /react-text --></li>
              </ul></td>
            </tr>
            <tr data-reactid="2007">
             <td class="param-name" data-reactid="2008"><strong data-reactid="2009">match</strong><br data-reactid="2010"><small data-reactid="2011"><em data-reactid="2012"></em></small></td>
             <td class="param-description object-definition-param-description" data-reactid="2013">
              <div data-reactid="2014">
               <p>Whether to match all search requirements or at least one (any)</p> 
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="2015">
               <small class="example-code" data-reactid="2016"><code data-reactid="2017">"all"</code></small>
              </div></td>
             <td class="param-constraints" data-reactid="2018">
              <ul class="constraints unstyled" data-reactid="2019">
               <li data-reactid="2020">default value: all</li>
               <li data-reactid="2021">
                <!-- react-text: 2022 -->valid values: 
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2023 -->any, all
                <!-- /react-text --></li>
              </ul></td>
            </tr>
           </tbody>
          </table>
         </div>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="2024">
         <!-- react-text: 2025 -->cURL 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="2026">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="2027">
         <pre data-reactid="2028">curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/user/organizations?status=member&amp;name=Cloudflare, Inc.&amp;page=1&amp;per_page=20&amp;order=status&amp;direction=desc&amp;match=all" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="afdadccaddefcad7cec2dfc3ca81ccc0c2">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json"</pre>

           <thead data-reactid="2231">

              <div data-reactid="2248">
               <p>Status of your response to the invitation (rejected or accepted)</p> 
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="2249">
               <small class="example-code" data-reactid="2250"><code data-reactid="2251">"accepted"</code></small>
              </div></td>

        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="2260">
         <pre data-reactid="2261">curl -X PATCH "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/user/invites/4f5f0c14a2a41d5063dd301b2f829f04" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="a5d0d6c0d7e5c0ddc4c8d5c9c08bc6cac8">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"status":"accepted"}'</pre>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="2262">

       <header data-reactid="2268">
        <div style="position:absolute;margin:-5em;" id="zone" data-reactid="2269"></div>
        <h2 data-reactid="2270">Zone</h2>
        <h4 class="subheadline" data-reactid="2271">A Zone is a domain name along with its subdomains and other identities</h4>
       </header>

           <!-- /react-text -->
           <!-- react-text: 2296 -->#zone:edit

         <div class="overflow-scroll object-definition-table" data-reactid="2318">

             <td data-reactid="2322">

             <td data-reactid="2325">

            <tr data-reactid="2330">
             <td class="param-name" data-reactid="2331"><strong data-reactid="2332">name</strong><br data-reactid="2333"><small data-reactid="2334"><em data-reactid="2335">
                <!-- react-text: 2336 -->string
                <!-- /react-text --></em></small></td>
             <td class="param-description object-definition-param-description" data-reactid="2337">
              <div data-reactid="2338">
               <p>The domain name</p> 
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="2339">
               <small class="example-code" data-reactid="2340"><code data-reactid="2341">"example.com"</code></small>
              </div></td>
             <td class="param-constraints" data-reactid="2342">
              <ul class="constraints unstyled" data-reactid="2343">
               <li data-reactid="2344">
                <!-- react-text: 2345 -->max length: 
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2346 -->253
                <!-- /react-text --></li>
               <li data-reactid="2347">read only</li>
               <li data-reactid="2348">
                <!-- react-text: 2349 -->pattern: 
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2350 -->^([a-zA-Z0-9][\-a-zA-Z0-9]*\.)+[\-a-zA-Z0-9]{2,20}$
                <!-- /react-text --></li>
              </ul></td>
            </tr>
           </tbody>
          </table>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div data-reactid="2351">

             <td data-reactid="2365">Constraints</td>

           <tbody data-reactid="2366">
            <tr data-reactid="2367">
             <td class="param-name" data-reactid="2368"><strong data-reactid="2369">jump_start</strong><br data-reactid="2370"><small data-reactid="2371"><em data-reactid="2372">
                <!-- react-text: 2373 -->boolean
                <!-- /react-text --></em></small></td>
             <td class="param-description object-definition-param-description" data-reactid="2374">
              <div data-reactid="2375">
               <p>Automatically attempt to fetch existing DNS records</p> 
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="2376">
               <small class="example-code" data-reactid="2377"><code data-reactid="2378">true</code></small>
              </div></td>
             <td class="param-constraints" data-reactid="2379">
              <ul class="constraints unstyled" data-reactid="2380">
               <li data-reactid="2381">default value: false</li>
               <li data-reactid="2382">valid values: (true,false)</li>
              </ul></td>
            </tr>
            <tr data-reactid="2383">
             <td class="param-name" data-reactid="2384"><strong data-reactid="2385">organization</strong><br data-reactid="2386"><small data-reactid="2387"><em data-reactid="2388">
                <!-- react-text: 2389 -->object
                <!-- /react-text --></em></small></td>
             <td class="param-description object-definition-param-description" data-reactid="2390">
              <div data-reactid="2391">
               <p>To create a zone owned by an organization, specify the organization parameter. Organization objects can be found in the <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="#user" title="null">User</a> or <a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="#user-s-organizations" title="null">User's Organizations</a> endpoints. You must pass at least the ID of the organization.</p> 
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="2392">
               <small class="example-code" data-reactid="2393"><code data-reactid="2394">{ "id": "01a7362d577a6c3019a474fd6f485823", "name": "Cloudflare, Inc.", "status": "active", "permissions": [ "#zones:read" ] }</code></small>
              </div></td>
             <td class="param-constraints" data-reactid="2395">
              <ul class="constraints unstyled" data-reactid="2396"></ul></td>
            </tr>
           </tbody>
          </table>
         </div>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="2397">
         <!-- react-text: 2398 -->cURL 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="2399">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="2400">
         <pre data-reactid="2401">curl -X POST "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="5a2f293f281a3f223b372a363f74393537">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"name":"example.com","jump_start":true,"organization":{"id":"01a7362d577a6c3019a474fd6f485823","name":"Cloudflare, Inc.","status":"active","permissions":["#zones:read"]}}'</pre>
        </div>

             <td class="param-constraints" data-reactid="2558">
              <ul class="constraints unstyled" data-reactid="2559">
               <li data-reactid="2560">default value: 20</li>
               <li data-reactid="2561">
                <!-- react-text: 2562 -->min value
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2563 -->:
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2564 -->5
                <!-- /react-text --></li>
               <li data-reactid="2565">
                <!-- react-text: 2566 -->max value
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2567 -->:
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2568 -->50
                <!-- /react-text --></li>
              </ul></td>
            </tr>
            <tr data-reactid="2569">
             <td class="param-name" data-reactid="2570"><strong data-reactid="2571">order</strong><br data-reactid="2572"><small data-reactid="2573"><em data-reactid="2574"></em></small></td>
             <td class="param-description object-definition-param-description" data-reactid="2575">
              <div data-reactid="2576">
               <p>Field to order zones by</p> 
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="2577">
               <small class="example-code" data-reactid="2578"><code data-reactid="2579">"status"</code></small>
              </div></td>
             <td class="param-constraints" data-reactid="2580">
              <ul class="constraints unstyled" data-reactid="2581">
               <li data-reactid="2582">
                <!-- react-text: 2583 -->valid values: 
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2584 -->name, status, email
                <!-- /react-text --></li>
              </ul></td>
            </tr>
            <tr data-reactid="2585">
             <td class="param-name" data-reactid="2586"><strong data-reactid="2587">direction</strong><br data-reactid="2588"><small data-reactid="2589"><em data-reactid="2590"></em></small></td>
             <td class="param-description object-definition-param-description" data-reactid="2591">
              <div data-reactid="2592">
               <p>Direction to order zones</p> 
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="2593">
               <small class="example-code" data-reactid="2594"><code data-reactid="2595">"desc"</code></small>
              </div></td>
             <td class="param-constraints" data-reactid="2596">
              <ul class="constraints unstyled" data-reactid="2597">
               <li data-reactid="2598">
                <!-- react-text: 2599 -->valid values: 
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2600 -->asc, desc
                <!-- /react-text --></li>
              </ul></td>
            </tr>
            <tr data-reactid="2601">
             <td class="param-name" data-reactid="2602"><strong data-reactid="2603">match</strong><br data-reactid="2604"><small data-reactid="2605"><em data-reactid="2606"></em></small></td>
             <td class="param-description object-definition-param-description" data-reactid="2607">
              <div data-reactid="2608">
               <p>Whether to match all search requirements or at least one (any)</p> 
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="2609">
               <small class="example-code" data-reactid="2610"><code data-reactid="2611">"all"</code></small>
              </div></td>
             <td class="param-constraints" data-reactid="2612">
              <ul class="constraints unstyled" data-reactid="2613">
               <li data-reactid="2614">default value: all</li>
               <li data-reactid="2615">
                <!-- react-text: 2616 -->valid values: 
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2617 -->any, all
                <!-- /react-text --></li>
              </ul></td>
            </tr>
           </tbody>
          </table>
         </div>
        </div>

             <td class="param-description object-definition-param-description" data-reactid="2817">
              <div data-reactid="2818">
               <p>A flag that indicates all resources in Cloudflare's cache should be removed. Note: This may have dramatic affects on your origin server load after performing this action.</p> 
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="2819">
               <small class="example-code" data-reactid="2820"><code data-reactid="2821">true</code></small>
              </div></td>
             <td class="param-constraints" data-reactid="2822">
              <ul class="constraints unstyled" data-reactid="2823">
               <li data-reactid="2824">
                <!-- react-text: 2825 -->valid values: 
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2826 -->true
                <!-- /react-text --></li>
              </ul></td>
            </tr>
           </tbody>
          </table>
         </div>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="2827">
         <!-- react-text: 2828 -->cURL 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="2829">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="2830">
         <pre data-reactid="2831">curl -X DELETE "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/purge_cache" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="691c1a0c1b290c11080419050c470a0604">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"purge_everything":true}'</pre>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="2832">
         <!-- react-text: 2833 -->Response 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="2834">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="2835">
         <pre data-reactid="2836">{
  "success": true,
  "errors": [
    {}
  ],
  "messages": [
    {}
  ],
  "result": {
    "id": "023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353"
  }
}</pre>
        </div>
       </section>
       <section class="modunit" data-reactid="2837">
        <a class="anchor2" id="zone-purge-individual-files-by-url-and-cache-tags" data-reactid="2838">zone-purge-individual-files-by-url-and-cache-tags</a>
        <div class="mod-header" data-reactid="2839">
         <h3 class="mod-title" data-reactid="2840"><span class="label label-info" data-reactid="2841">DELETE</span>
          <!-- react-text: 2842 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 2843 -->Purge individual files by URL and Cache-Tags
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 2844 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 2845 --> 
          <!-- /react-text --><small data-reactid="2846">
           <!-- react-text: 2847 -->permission needed: 
           <!-- /react-text -->
           <!-- react-text: 2848 -->#zone:edit
           <!-- /react-text --></small>
          <ul class="available-plans inline" data-reactid="2849">
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="2850"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="2851">free</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="2852"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="2853"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="2854">pro</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="2855"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="2856"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="2857">business</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="2858"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="2859"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="2860">enterprise</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="2861"></div></li>
          </ul></h3>
         <div data-reactid="2862">
          <p>Granularly remove one or more files from Cloudflare's cache either by specifying the URL or the associated Cache-Tag. All tiers can purge by URL. Cache-Tag is for Enterprise only.</p> 
          <p><strong>NB:</strong> Cache-Tag purging has a rate limit of up to 2,000 purge API calls in every 24 hour period. You may purge up to 30 tags in one API call.</p> 
         </div>
         <pre class="language-http" style="margin:0.5em 0 0;" data-reactid="2863">
          <!-- react-text: 2864 -->DELETE
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 2865 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 2866 -->zones/:identifier/purge_cache
          <!-- /react-text --></pre>
        </div>
        <div data-reactid="2867">
         <h4 class="mod-content" data-reactid="2868"><em data-reactid="2869">Optional</em>
          <!-- react-text: 2870 --> parameters
          <!-- /react-text --></h4>
         <div class="overflow-scroll object-definition-table" data-reactid="2871">
          <table class="table table-striped" data-reactid="2872">
           <thead data-reactid="2873">
            <tr data-reactid="2874">
             <td data-reactid="2875">
              <!-- react-text: 2876 -->Name 
              <!-- /react-text --><small data-reactid="2877">/type</small></td>
             <td data-reactid="2878">
              <!-- react-text: 2879 -->Description 
              <!-- /react-text --><small data-reactid="2880">/example</small></td>
             <td data-reactid="2881">Constraints</td>
            </tr>
           </thead>
           <tbody data-reactid="2882">
            <tr data-reactid="2883">
             <td class="param-name" data-reactid="2884"><strong data-reactid="2885">files</strong><br data-reactid="2886"><small data-reactid="2887"><em data-reactid="2888">
                <!-- react-text: 2889 -->array
                <!-- /react-text --></em></small></td>
             <td class="param-description object-definition-param-description" data-reactid="2890">
              <div data-reactid="2891">
               <p>An array of URLs that should be removed from cache</p> 
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="2892">
               <small class="example-code" data-reactid="2893"><code data-reactid="2894">[ "http://www.example.com/css/styles.css" ]</code></small>
              </div></td>
             <td class="param-constraints" data-reactid="2895">
              <ul class="constraints unstyled" data-reactid="2896">
               <li data-reactid="2897">
                <!-- react-text: 2898 -->max length: 
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2899 -->30
                <!-- /react-text --></li>
              </ul></td>
            </tr>
            <tr data-reactid="2900">
             <td class="param-name" data-reactid="2901"><strong data-reactid="2902">tags</strong><br data-reactid="2903"><small data-reactid="2904"><em data-reactid="2905">
                <!-- react-text: 2906 -->array
                <!-- /react-text --></em></small></td>
             <td class="param-description object-definition-param-description" data-reactid="2907">
              <div data-reactid="2908">
               <p>Any assets served with a Cache-Tag header that matches one of the provided values will be purged from the Cloudflare cache</p> 
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="2909">
               <small class="example-code" data-reactid="2910"><code data-reactid="2911">[ "some-tag", "another-tag" ]</code></small>
              </div></td>
             <td class="param-constraints" data-reactid="2912">
              <ul class="constraints unstyled" data-reactid="2913">
               <li data-reactid="2914">
                <!-- react-text: 2915 -->max length: 
                <!-- /react-text -->
                <!-- react-text: 2916 -->30
                <!-- /react-text --></li>
              </ul></td>
            </tr>
           </tbody>
          </table>
         </div>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="2917">
         <!-- react-text: 2918 -->cURL 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="2919">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="2920">
         <pre data-reactid="2921">curl -X DELETE "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/purge_cache" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="6114120413210419000c110d044f020e0c">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"files":["http://www.example.com/css/styles.css"],"tags":["some-tag","another-tag"]}'</pre>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="2922">

      <article class="section api-section" data-reactid="3152">
       <header data-reactid="3153">
        <div style="position:absolute;margin:-5em;" id="zone-rate-plan" data-reactid="3154"></div>
        <h2 data-reactid="3155">Zone Rate Plan</h2>
        <h4 class="subheadline" data-reactid="3156">A zone rate plan from the billing service</h4>
       </header>

      {
        "name": "page_rules",

    ]
  }

          </ul></h3>
         <div data-reactid="3451">
          <p>Browser Cache TTL (in seconds) specifies how long Cloudflare-cached resources will remain on your visitors' computers. Cloudflare will honor any larger times specified by your server. (<a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168276" title="null">https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168276</a>)</p>

            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3490"></div></li>
          </ul></h3>
         <div data-reactid="3491">
          <p>Browser Integrity Check is similar to Bad Behavior and looks for common HTTP headers abused most commonly by spammers and denies access to your page. It will also challenge visitors that do not have a user agent or a non standard user agent (also commonly used by abuse bots, crawlers or visitors). (<a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170086" title="null">https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170086</a>)</p>

       <section class="modunit" data-reactid="3506">
        <a class="anchor2" id="zone-settings-get-cache-level-setting" data-reactid="3507">zone-settings-get-cache-level-setting</a>
        <div class="mod-header" data-reactid="3508">
         <h3 class="mod-title" data-reactid="3509"><span class="label label-info" data-reactid="3510">GET</span>
          <!-- react-text: 3511 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3512 -->Get Cache Level setting
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3513 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3514 --> 
          <!-- /react-text --><small data-reactid="3515">
           <!-- react-text: 3516 -->permission needed: 
           <!-- /react-text -->
           <!-- react-text: 3517 -->#zone_settings:read
           <!-- /react-text --></small>
          <ul class="available-plans inline" data-reactid="3518">
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3519"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3520">free</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3521"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3522"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3523">pro</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3524"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3525"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3526">business</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3527"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3528"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3529">enterprise</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3530"></div></li>
          </ul></h3>
         <div data-reactid="3531">
          <p>Cache Level functions based off the setting level. The basic setting will cache most static resources (i.e., css, images, and JavaScript). The simplified setting will ignore the query string when delivering a cached resource. The aggressive setting will cache all static resources, including ones with a query string. (<a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168256" title="null">https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168256</a>)</p> 
         </div>
         <pre class="language-http" style="margin:0.5em 0 0;" data-reactid="3532">
          <!-- react-text: 3533 -->GET
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3534 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3535 -->zones/:zone_identifier/settings/cache_level
          <!-- /react-text --></pre>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="3536">
         <!-- react-text: 3537 -->cURL 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="3538">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="3539">
         <pre data-reactid="3540">curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/settings/cache_level" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="a0d5d3c5d2e0c5d8c1cdd0ccc58ec3cfcd">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json"</pre>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="3541">
         <!-- react-text: 3542 -->Response 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="3543">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="3544">
         <pre data-reactid="3545">{
  "success": true,
  "errors": [

       <section class="modunit" data-reactid="3546">
        <a class="anchor2" id="zone-settings-get-challenge-ttl-setting" data-reactid="3547">zone-settings-get-challenge-ttl-setting</a>
        <div class="mod-header" data-reactid="3548">
         <h3 class="mod-title" data-reactid="3549"><span class="label label-info" data-reactid="3550">GET</span>
          <!-- react-text: 3551 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3552 -->Get Challenge TTL setting
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3553 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3554 --> 
          <!-- /react-text --><small data-reactid="3555">
           <!-- react-text: 3556 -->permission needed: 
           <!-- /react-text -->
           <!-- react-text: 3557 -->#zone_settings:read
           <!-- /react-text --></small>
          <ul class="available-plans inline" data-reactid="3558">
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3559"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3560">free</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3561"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3562"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3563">pro</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3564"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3565"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3566">business</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3567"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3568"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3569">enterprise</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3570"></div></li>
          </ul></h3>
         <div data-reactid="3571">
          <p>Specify how long a visitor is allowed access to your site after successfully completing a challenge (such as a CAPTCHA). After the TTL has expired the visitor will have to complete a new challenge. We recommend a 15 - 45 minute setting and will attempt to honor any setting above 45 minutes. (<a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170136" title="null">https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170136</a>)</p> 
         </div>
         <pre class="language-http" style="margin:0.5em 0 0;" data-reactid="3572">
          <!-- react-text: 3573 -->GET
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3574 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3575 -->zones/:zone_identifier/settings/challenge_ttl
          <!-- /react-text --></pre>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="3576">
         <!-- react-text: 3577 -->cURL 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="3578">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="3579">
         <pre data-reactid="3580">curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/settings/challenge_ttl" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="651016001725001d04081509004b060a08">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json"</pre>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="3581">
         <!-- react-text: 3582 -->Response 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="3583">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="3584">
         <pre data-reactid="3585">{
  "success": true,
  "errors": [
    {}
  ],
  "messages": [
    {}
  ],
  "result": {

    "value": 1800,
    "editable": true,

       <section class="modunit" data-reactid="3586">
        <a class="anchor2" id="zone-settings-get-development-mode-setting" data-reactid="3587">zone-settings-get-development-mode-setting</a>
        <div class="mod-header" data-reactid="3588">
         <h3 class="mod-title" data-reactid="3589"><span class="label label-info" data-reactid="3590">GET</span>
          <!-- react-text: 3591 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3592 -->Get Development Mode setting
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3593 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3594 --> 
          <!-- /react-text --><small data-reactid="3595">
           <!-- react-text: 3596 -->permission needed: 
           <!-- /react-text -->
           <!-- react-text: 3597 -->#zone_settings:read
           <!-- /react-text --></small>
          <ul class="available-plans inline" data-reactid="3598">
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3599"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3600">free</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3601"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3602"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3603">pro</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3604"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3605"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3606">business</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3607"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3608"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3609">enterprise</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3610"></div></li>
          </ul></h3>
         <div data-reactid="3611">
          <p>Development Mode temporarily allows you to enter development mode for your websites if you need to make changes to your site. This will bypass Cloudflare's accelerated cache and slow down your site, but is useful if you are making changes to cacheable content (like images, css, or JavaScript) and would like to see those changes right away. Once entered, development mode will last for 3 hours and then automatically toggle off.</p> 
         </div>
         <pre class="language-http" style="margin:0.5em 0 0;" data-reactid="3612">
          <!-- react-text: 3613 -->GET
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3614 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3615 -->zones/:zone_identifier/settings/development_mode
          <!-- /react-text --></pre>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="3616">
         <!-- react-text: 3617 -->cURL 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="3618">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="3619">
         <pre data-reactid="3620">curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/settings/development_mode" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="c4b1b7a1b684a1bca5a9b4a8a1eaa7aba9">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json"</pre>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="3621">
         <!-- react-text: 3622 -->Response 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="3623">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="3624">
         <pre data-reactid="3625">{
  "success": true,
  "errors": [
    {}
  ],
  "messages": [
    {}
  ],
  "result": {
    "id": "development_mode",
    "value": "off",
    "editable": true,
    "modified_on": "2014-01-01T05:20:00.12345Z",
    "time_remaining": 3600
  }

        </div>
       </section>

       <section class="modunit" data-reactid="3666">
        <a class="anchor2" id="zone-settings-get-hotlink-protection-setting" data-reactid="3667">zone-settings-get-hotlink-protection-setting</a>
        <div class="mod-header" data-reactid="3668">
         <h3 class="mod-title" data-reactid="3669"><span class="label label-info" data-reactid="3670">GET</span>
          <!-- react-text: 3671 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3672 -->Get Hotlink Protection setting
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3673 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3674 --> 
          <!-- /react-text --><small data-reactid="3675">
           <!-- react-text: 3676 -->permission needed: 
           <!-- /react-text -->
           <!-- react-text: 3677 -->#zone_settings:read
           <!-- /react-text --></small>
          <ul class="available-plans inline" data-reactid="3678">
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3679"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3680">free</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3681"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3682"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3683">pro</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3684"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3685"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3686">business</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3687"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="3688"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="3689">enterprise</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="3690"></div></li>
          </ul></h3>
         <div data-reactid="3691">
          <p>When enabled, the Hotlink Protection option ensures that other sites cannot suck up your bandwidth by building pages that use images hosted on your site. Anytime a request for an image on your site hits Cloudflare, we check to ensure that it's not another site requesting them. People will still be able to download and view images from your page, but other sites won't be able to steal them for use on their own pages. (<a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170026" title="null">https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170026</a>)</p> 
         </div>
         <pre class="language-http" style="margin:0.5em 0 0;" data-reactid="3692">
          <!-- react-text: 3693 -->GET
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3694 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 3695 -->zones/:zone_identifier/settings/hotlink_protection
          <!-- /react-text --></pre>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="3696">
         <!-- react-text: 3697 -->cURL 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="3698">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="3699">
         <pre data-reactid="3700">curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/settings/hotlink_protection" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="daafa9bfa89abfa2bbb7aab6bff4b9b5b7">[email&nbsp;protected]</a>" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json"</pre>
        </div>

       <section class="modunit" data-reactid="4106">
        <a class="anchor2" id="zone-settings-get-response-buffering-setting" data-reactid="4107">zone-settings-get-response-buffering-setting</a>
        <div class="mod-header" data-reactid="4108">

           <li class="plan unavailable" data-reactid="4125"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="4126">business</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-remove small" data-reactid="4127"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="4128"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="4129">enterprise</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="4130"></div></li>
          </ul></h3>
         <div data-reactid="4131">
          <p>Enables or disables buffering of responses from the proxied server. Cloudflare may buffer the whole payload to deliver it at once to the client versus allowing it to be delivered in chunks. By default, the proxied server streams directly and is not buffered by Cloudflare. This is limited to Enterprise Zones.</p> 
         </div>

       <section class="modunit" data-reactid="4146">
        <a class="anchor2" id="zone-settings-get-rocket-loader-setting" data-reactid="4147">zone-settings-get-rocket-loader-setting</a>
        <div class="mod-header" data-reactid="4148">
         <h3 class="mod-title" data-reactid="4149"><span class="label label-info" data-reactid="4150">GET</span>
          <!-- react-text: 4151 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 4152 -->Get Rocket Loader setting
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 4153 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 4154 --> 
          <!-- /react-text --><small data-reactid="4155">
           <!-- react-text: 4156 -->permission needed: 
           <!-- /react-text -->
           <!-- react-text: 4157 -->#zone_settings:read
           <!-- /react-text --></small>
          <ul class="available-plans inline" data-reactid="4158">
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="4159"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="4160">free</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="4161"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="4162"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="4163">pro</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="4164"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="4165"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="4166">business</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="4167"></div></li>
           <li class="plan false" data-reactid="4168"><h6 class="uppercase inline" data-reactid="4169">enterprise</h6>
            <div class="icon icon-ok text-success small" data-reactid="4170"></div></li>
          </ul></h3>
         <div data-reactid="4171">
          <p>Rocket Loader is a general-purpose asynchronous JavaScript loader coupled with a lightweight virtual browser which can safely run any JavaScript code after window.onload. Turning on Rocket Loader will immediately improve a web page's window.onload time (assuming there is JavaScript on the page), which can have a positive impact on your Google search ranking. Automatic Mode: Rocket Loader will automatically run on the JavaScript resources on your site, with no configuration required after turning on automatic mode. Manual Mode: In order to have Rocket Loader execute for a particular script, you must add the following attribute to the script tag: "data-cfasync='true'". As your page passes through Cloudflare, we'll enable Rocket Loader for that particular script. All other JavaScript will continue to execute without Cloudflare touching the script. (<a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168056" title="null">https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168056</a>)</p> 
         </div>
         <pre class="language-http" style="margin:0.5em 0 0;" data-reactid="4172">
          <!-- react-text: 4173 -->GET
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 4174 --> 
          <!-- /react-text -->
          <!-- react-text: 4175 -->zones/:zone_identifier/settings/rocket_loader
          <!-- /react-text --></pre>
        </div>
        <h5 class="mod-content" data-reactid="4176">
         <!-- react-text: 4177 -->cURL 
         <!-- /react-text --><small class="text-warning" data-reactid="4178">(example)</small></h5>
        <div class="CodeMirror cm-s-default" data-reactid="4179">
         <pre data-reactid="4180">curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/settings/rocket_loader" \
